alert.note: Alert for Lebanon (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 4:14PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN LEBANON COUNTY THROUGH 445 PM EDT... At 414 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hershey, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Palmyra, Campbelltown, Timber Hills, Mount Gretna Heights, Lawn and Mount Gretna. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for south central Pennsylvania.
